text:
Sheriff Street, north from and including Grand Street, showing (right), the plants of R.Hoe & Co., extending to Delancey after crossing Broome Streets. (The plants are now, 1937, demolished). Also shown is a portion of the Williamsburg Bridge.

April 1, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Grand Street, north side, east from and including Sheriff, to and including Columbia Streets. Also shown is Sheriff Street, east side, north from and including Grand, to and including Delancey Streets. In the background on Delancey Street, is the Williamsburg Bridge.

About 1930.

Joseph P. Day.

(1) Grand Street, north side, between Sheriff and Columbia Streets. (Street front not shown). Also shown is Broome Street north side, east from but not including Sheriff, to and including Columbia Streets. Included also is Columbia Street, east side, south from and including Broome, to, but not including Grand Streets. The view shows in the foreground, work in progress for the erection of a model apartment house on the site of the old R. Hoe and Company Plant, and in the background a portion of the Williamsburg Bridge.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a closer view.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, from a different angle, as No. 1 and showing Columbia Street, west side, north from and including Broome Street.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Grand Street, north side, between Sheriff and Columbia Streets. (Street front not shown). Also shown is Broome Street north side, east from but not including Sheriff, to and including Columbia Streets. Included also is Columbia Street, east side, south from and including Broome, to, but not including Grand Streets. The view shows in the foreground, work in progress for the erection of a model apartment house on the site of the old R. Hoe and Company Plant, and in the background a portion of the Williamsburg Bridge.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a closer view.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, from a different angle, as No. 1 and showing Columbia Street, west side, north from and including Broome Street.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Grand Street, north side, between Sheriff and Columbia Streets. (Street front not shown). Also shown is Broome Street north side, east from but not including Sheriff, to and including Columbia Streets. Included also is Columbia Street, east side, south from and including Broome, to, but not including Grand Streets. The view shows in the foreground, work in progress for the erection of a model apartment house on the site of the old R. Hoe and Company Plant, and in the background a portion of the Williamsburg Bridge.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a closer view.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, from a different angle, as No. 1 and showing Columbia Street, west side, north from and including Broome Street.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Grand Street, north side, west from, but not including Sheriff, to, but not including Pitt Streets. The intersecting street shown, is Willett Street. The factory building, Nos. 494-498, a former bakery, is being vacated.

March 23, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A closer view of Nos. 494-500. The bakery being Nos. 494-498.

March 23, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Grand Street, north side, west from, but not including Sheriff, to, but not including Pitt Streets. The intersecting street shown, is Willett Street. The factory building, Nos. 494-498, a former bakery, is being vacated.

March 23, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A closer view of Nos. 494-500. The bakery being Nos. 494-498.

March 23, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

507 to 515 Grand Street (right to left), south side, between East Broadway and Henry Street. The two dormier windowed structures are No's. 511 and 513. No. 515 is on the left and is a frame structure with a brick front.

1939

Gift of Beecher Ogden
